text: Hi Alex, found your channel two weeks ago (5 reasons not to be a data analyst was the first video of yours that I saw). I am just beginning the process of learning SQL and the other skills you highlight so I can change careers (25 years in retail grocery as a cashier) and live in a suburb of ATL.  I'd like to ask about the following situation: what are your thoughts about contract or contract-to-hire or gig jobs appearing on an application for someone looking for that first Jr Data Analyst position who has no other experience other than cashierintmg? Is seeing a bunch of temporary contract work a plus or a minus on an application,  when applying for that full time job. (I have a particular domestic situation that keeps me tied to retail)

author: @taylorbosier
text: Informative. Lighting, audio, and camera are crisp. Clothing and background don't matter so long as the material is good, which it is! I think hearing about the other sides' perspective is informative and gears up the listener who is seeking advice. At moments, it seemed like the conversation tailed off track but in this long format it feels more organic than just reading off a script. From my studies, professors who walk in with bullet points and ensure they covered the bullet points in the 45 minute setting did a way better job teaching than those who came in with a full on script. Thanks for mixing it up!
